title: Surveying mangrove ecosystems for a national carbon stock assessment in Pohnpei, Federated States of Micronesia (FSM)
collaborators: US Forest Service, FSM Department of Environment, Climate Change & Emergency Management (DECEM), US Geological Survey
summary: In a collaboration between the United States and FSM governments, a major undertaking was completed to survey and evaluate the carbon stock and species composition of the mangrove forests of Pohnpei.
role: To help this project, I led one of three field teams measuring plot-level information on mangrove structure, composition, and carbon content.

title: Field site visits to evaluate maps of forest degradation in Iquitos, Peru.
collaborators: Dr. Curtis E. Woodcock, Dr. Paulo Arevalo, The Research Institute Of The Peruvian Amazon (IIAP)
summary: As part of my dissertation, I developed a satellite remote sensing algorithm to track forest degradation and deforestation in the tropics.
role: After applying this algorithm to the entire Amazon Ecoregion and performing a proper accuracy assessment, we selected targetted sites in the Iquitos region to field sites to further understand the spectral response to different tyes of forest degradation.
